summary:
Coca is a South American plant with a long history of use by indigenous peoples. It contains a substance called cocaine, which is known worldwide. People have grown coca for over 8,000 years for its stimulating and medicinal properties. It is a crucial part of many South American cultures and is used in spiritual and social traditions.

The plant is cultivated as a cash crop in several South American countries, even where it's illegal. Its leaves contain cocaine, ranging from 0.23% to 0.96%. Historically, Coca-Cola used an extract from these leaves, but later changed to a cocaine-free version.
title: Coca
